message_1: A substitution cipher replaces each letter in a message with a different letter of the alphabet. In a particular substitution cipher, the letter "A" is always replaced with the letter "D", while the other letters remain the same. If the encrypted message "Dlrrk zruog" was received, what was the original message?
message_2:
To decrypt the message, we need to reverse the substitution process. Since "A" is replaced with "D", we can assume that the substitution is a simple Caesar cipher with a shift of 3 positions back in the alphabet. 

So, we will shift each letter in the encrypted message 3 positions back:

D -> A
l -> i
r -> o
r -> o
k -> h
(space remains the same)
z -> w
r -> o
u -> r
o -> l
g -> d

The decrypted message is: "Alooh world".
